page.title: 15LITTLE CANFIELD, THE VILLAGE
page.content: Little Canfield no longer has any shops or retail outlets, the school has closed as has the Post Office and the village has become an isolated community. Several of the cottages are now owned by weekenders and the old community spirit is dying away. Small country cottages have been bought as investment properties renovated, extended and sold at very high prices beyond the means of the local working population. There is still a village hall which provides accommodation for local groups to socialise, and at present acts as the church. There are also allotments at Little Canfield which are carefully tended by local people.
